get.description:
Role Definitions (roles) contain a list of permissions and can be used to
assign those permissions to a user or team through the respective
assignment endpoints.

Custom roles can be created, modified, and deleted through this endpoint.
System-managed roles are shown here, which cannot be edited or deleted,
but can be assigned to users.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

Role Definitions (roles) contain a list of permissions and can be used to
assign those permissions to a user or team through the respective
assignment endpoints.

Custom roles can be created, modified, and deleted through this endpoint.
System-managed roles are shown here, which cannot be edited or deleted,
but can be assigned to users.

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

get.description:

parameters.name: id

200.description: No response body

get.description:
General data about models and permissions tracked by django-ansible-base RBAC

Information from this endpoint should be static given a server version.
This reflects model definitions, registrations with the permission registry,
and enablement of RBAC features in settings.

allowed_permissions: Valid permissions for a role of a given content_type

200.description: No response body

get.description:

This is a list-only view that provides a list of users, plus extra data.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

get.description:
This gives drill-down information about the means of inheritance
for all the permissions show in the higher-level view of the access list

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

get.description:
Use this endpoint to give a team permission to a resource or an organization.
The needed data is the team, the role definition, and the object id.
The object must be of the type specified in the role definition.
The type given in the role definition and the provided object_id are used
to look up the resource.

After creation, the assignment cannot be edited, but can be deleted to
remove those permissions.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

app_label.description: Django app that the model is in. This is an internal technical detail that does not affect API use.

model.description: Name of the type according to the Django ORM Meta model_name convention. Comes from the python class, but lowercase with no spaces.

parent_content_type.description: String to use for references to this type from other models in the API.

pk_field_type.description: Database field type of the primary key field of the model, relevant for interal logic tracking permissions.

codename.description: A codename for the permission, in the format {action}_{model_name}. Where action is typically the view set action (view/list/etc) from Django rest framework.

pull_policy.description:
Pull policy for the image before running

* `always` - Always pull container before running.
* `missing` - Only pull the image if not present before running.
* `never` - Never pull container before running.

* `running` - running
